intro: Cochlospermum orinocense, commonly known as the Orinoco cockspur, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers and palmate leaves. The plant produces elongated, woody fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural gardens.
